quotes.quote: Obsession and repetition in the process of making things is one constant element in my work.
For a true disciple, the repetition of the mantra is like food.
There is no substitute for attentive repetition.
Constant repetition carries conviction.
By repetition, each lie becomes an irreversible fact upon which other lies are constructed.
Only constant repetition will finally succeed in imprinting an idea on the memory of the crowd.
Repetition does not transform a lie into a truth.
The frequent repetition of miracles serves to provoke, where it does not subdue, the reason of mankind.
Repetition is the mother of learning, the father of action, which makes it the architect of accomplishment.
Thinking is a habit, and like any other habit, it can be changed; it just takes effort and repetition.
The mind naturally accommodates itself, even to the most ridiculous improprieties, if they occur frequently.
We learn as professionals by repetition, by getting it wrong, getting yelled at and doing it again.
Repetition is not repetition. The same action makes you feel something completely different by the end
Repetition is the death of magic.
Change begets change as much as repetition reinforces repetition.
We are what we repeatedly do. Excellence, then, is not an act, but a habit.
There can be a lot of longevity in the repetition of things being told again and again in a variety of ways.
Repetition is a revolutionary virtue.
Repetition is the only form of permanence that Nature can achieve.
Repetition is the reality and the seriousness of life.
Repetition is the mother of pedagogy.
Repetition of the same thought or physical action develops into a habit which, repeated frequently enough, becomes an automatic reflex.
Human beings are repetitive animals. All meaning is generated through repetition.
We're taught by repetition but great innovators need to be great at doing the different.
If you re-read your work, you can find on re-reading a great deal of repetition can be avoided by re-reading and editing.
Repetition is based on body rhythms, so we identify with the heartbeat, or with walking, or with breathing.
Happiness is the longing for repetition.
You affect your subconscious mind by verbal repetition.
Christ's work needs no repetition. It is final because it is perfect.
Happiness consists in frequent repetition of pleasure.
